Viola Davis kicks off Oscars weekend with an eye-popping gown Maeve McDermott , USATODAY 1:31 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 
What a trio: Octavia Spencer, Viola Davis and Ruth Negga all attended Alfre Woodard's Sistahs Soiree. (Photo: Todd Williamson, WireImage) 
The Academy Awards aren't until Sunday, but Viola Davis already has plenty to celebrate ‚Äî like her BAFTA, Golden Globe, Critics' Choice and Screen Actors Guild Awards wins for her powerhouse Fences performance. 
Ahead of Hollywood's biggest night, Davis stepped out at Alfre Woodard's Oscars Sistahs Soiree. Instead of the colorful gowns she normally favors, the 51-year-old actress opted for a black dress with a patterned skirt and extra-deep V.

In an interview with the New York Times , Davis' stylist Elizabeth Stewart explained that the actress doesn't normally favor cleavage-bearing gowns. ‚ÄúWe like to contain the girls whenever possible,‚Äù Ms. Stewart joked. ‚ÄúKeep them safe.‚Äù 
Stewart also summed up Davis' fashion mantra, one that certainly applies to her Sistahs Soiree gown. "She likes fitted, clean and graphic...There‚Äôs not a lot of agonizing over choices with Viola.‚Äù 
Expect to see more award-winning fashion when Davis hits the Oscars red carpet Sunday. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
